trans-unit.source: The exception that is thrown when a XAML reader cannot process elements of the XAML reader source into a XAML node stream.

For cases where line information is available (such as when the XAML node stream is read by a <xref:System.Xaml.XamlXmlReader>), and for certain exception cases, a <xref:System.Xaml.XamlParseException> can report line information from the source of the XAML node stream.

This information is appended to the <xref:System.Xaml.XamlException.Message%2A>, and is also contained in <xref:System.Xaml.XamlException.LineNumber%2A> and <xref:System.Xaml.XamlException.LinePosition%2A>.
Each of these members is implemented by the <xref:System.Xaml.XamlException> base class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Xaml.XamlParseException"></xref> class with a system-supplied message that describes the error.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Xaml.XamlParseException"></xref> class with a specified message that describes the error.
The message that describes the exception.
The caller of this constructor is required to ensure that this string has been localized for the current system culture.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Xaml.XamlParseException"></xref> class with serialized data.
The object that holds the serialized object data.
The contextual information about the source or destination.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Xaml.XamlParseException"></xref> class with a specified error message and a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.
An exception that is thrown as a direct result of a previous exception should include a reference to the previous exception in the <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property.

The <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property returns the same value that is passed into the constructor, or `null` if the <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property does not supply the inner exception value to the constructor.
The message that describes the exception.
The caller of this constructor is required to ensure that this string has been localized for the current system culture.
The exception that is the cause of the current exception.
If the innerException parameter is not `null`, the current exception is raised in a `catch` block that handles the inner exception.
